name: Vegan Miso Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Not your average vegan chocolate chip cookies.
recipeIngredient: 1  flax egg (1 tablespoon flaxseed meal + 3 tablespoons water)
1/2 cup vegan dark chocolate chips (more as desired)

recipeInstructions.name: Make the flax egg. In a small bowl, combine flaxseed meal and water. Mix well, and let sit at room temperature for at least 5 minutes, or until thickened.
recipeInstructions.text: Make the flax egg. In a small bowl, combine flaxseed meal and water. Mix well, and let sit at room temperature for at least 5 minutes, or until thickened.

recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and baking soda.
recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, and baking soda.

recipeInstructions.name: In another large bowl, whisk together room temperature vegan butter, brown sugar, and miso. Cream this mixture for around three minutes, until its homogenous and nicely incorporated.
recipeInstructions.text: In another large bowl, whisk together room temperature vegan butter, brown sugar, and miso. Cream this mixture for around three minutes, until its homogenous and nicely incorporated.

recipeInstructions.name: Add the flax egg into the creamed mixture and mix well. Then in goes the dry ingredients (mixed in step 1), followed by chocolate chips. Mix everything together well.
recipeInstructions.text: Add the flax egg into the creamed mixture and mix well. Then in goes the dry ingredients (mixed in step 1), followed by chocolate chips. Mix everything together well.

recipeInstructions.name: Scoop the mixture and shape them into balls — I portioned it into 6 balls. Place them onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper and chill in the fridge for at least thirty minutes.*
recipeInstructions.text: Scoop the mixture and shape them into balls — I portioned it into 6 balls. Place them onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper and chill in the fridge for at least thirty minutes.*

recipeInstructions.name: When thirty minutes is almost up, pre-heat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (356 Fahrenheit). Bake the cookies for 16-18 minutes, or until they are golden-brown.  Cool them on a wire wrack and enjoy while still warm.
recipeInstructions.text: When thirty minutes is almost up, pre-heat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (356 Fahrenheit). Bake the cookies for 16-18 minutes, or until they are golden-brown.  Cool them on a wire wrack and enjoy while still warm.
